snippet: Foreign Minister Paolo Gentiloni dismissed reports that Rome had agreed to hand over $14 million to free two aid workers who were taken hostage in Syria.
abstract: Italian Foreign Min Paolo Gentiloni denies that country paid ransom of $12 million euros, or about $14 million, for release of Greta Ramelli and Vanessa Marzullo, two aid workers taken hostage in Syria by Nusra Front.
lead_paragraph: Foreign Minister Paolo Gentiloni dismissed reports that Rome had agreed to hand over $14 million to free two aid workers who were taken hostage in Syria.

headline.main: Italy Denies Paying Ransom for Release of Aid Workers
headline.print_headline: Italy: Official Denies Reports About Ransom Payments
